article.title: Finite and infinite quotients of discrete and indiscrete groups

choices: The Cayley graph of the full automorphism group of a tree.
The local action of an element a ∈ A on the tree factor TX at the base vertex 1X.
The projection of the BMW-group onto the automorphism group of TA.
The action of an anti-torus on the product of two trees.

multiple_choice_question.text: In the context of Figure 1, what is the effect of the element a on the directed edge (1,x)?
choices: It maps (1,x) to (a,x).
It maps (1,x) to (a,ax).
It maps (1,x) to (1,(x\')<sup>-1</sup>).
It fixes the edge (1,x).

multiple_choice_question.text: How does the presence of the relation axax\' in the set R influence the local action depicted in Figure 1?
choices: It indicates that a acts as an involution on the edge (1,x).
It implies that the projection of (a, ax) to TX coincides with (1,(x\')<sup>-1</sup>).
It forces the local action of a at 1X to be trivial.
It has no influence on the local action.

multiple_choice_question.text: What can be effectively computed by analyzing diagrams like Figure 1?
choices: The exact structure of the full automorphism group of a tree.
The global action of the BMW-group on the product of two trees.
The local action of the BMW-group at a chosen vertex of TA or TX.
The index of the finite residual of the BMW-group.
A complete classification of all BMW-groups up to isomorphism.
The degrees and local actions of various BMW-groups on their respective tree factors.
The exact structure of the finite residuals of the listed BMW-groups.
The presentations of all irreducible BMW-groups of degree ≤ 6.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following groups listed in Table 1 has a nilpotent local action on at least one of its tree factors?
choices: ΓRung
ΓSV
ΓRatt

multiple_choice_question.text: According to Table 1, which group\'s local action on both tree factors is isomorphic to PGL2(F3)?
choices: ΓSV
ΓRatt
ΓJW
ΓRung

multiple_choice_question.text: What can be concluded about the irreducibility of a BMW-group based on Table 1 and Corollary 4.13?
choices: If the local action on at least one tree factor is 2-transitive, the group is irreducible.
If the local action on both tree factors is intransitive, the group is reducible.
If the local action satisfies certain conditions related to its transitivity and structure, it can be used as a sufficient (but not necessary) condition for irreducibility.
The table provides no information about irreducibility.
